com.astrocalculator

Class AstroDateTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.astrocalculator.AstroDateTime

  • public class AstroDateTime
extends java.lang.Object
    Class describing date and time for the needs of AstroCalculator class It is used to set date and time for calculations and to return results e.g. sunrise/sunset type etc.

      • AstroDateTime

      • AstroDateTime

        public AstroDateTime(int year,
             int month,
             int day,
             int hour,
             int minute,
             int second,
             int timezoneOffset,
             boolean daylightSaving)
        Constructor allowing object initialization with the date and time
        Parameters:
        year - Calendar year (e.g. 2016)
        month - Month number (1 - for January, 2 - for February, etc.)
        day - Day of month (1-31)
        hour - Hour (0 - 23)
        minute - Minute (0 - 59)
        second - Second (0 - 59)
        timezoneOffset - Time zone offset (in hours)
        daylightSaving - Flag indicating if daylight saving is applicable or not
